alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 1:29PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties through 200 PM MST... At 129 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Sun Valley, or 46 miles north of Show Low, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Petrified Forest National Park and Petrified Forest N.P. Visitors Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
